title: >>> "FAMILY" FEUD
body_text:
Broken fingers, faceshots, bloody noses, nutshots ... despite friendship keeping dodgeball alive, don't ever think for one second your supposed "friends" will take it easy on the court.
DODGEBALL 66 was a prime example that friends become more than enemies.
Team STOPA vs. Team LEWIS
For the third week running, dodgeball witnessed the emergence of two brand new captains. Kathryn Nogueira and Aimee Savoth started the trend at DODGEBALL LXIV, followed by the wild battle between Sascha Basista and Joey Smalls just last week. At DODGEBALL 66, friends-turned-foes Lauren Stopa and Merri Lewis participated in a rare female-only fray.
- Justin Pierce (Team STOPA) vs. Jeff Semienski (Team LEWIS) was an absolute shouting match. The inexperienced Semienski took everything "The Piercer" dished out, despite an age difference. Much credit to both men as neither backed down.
- Semi-regular Steve Kass (Team LEWIS) hadn't even planned on participating at DODGEBALL 66. But he did and unfortunately halfway through, was met with numbing (literally) faceshot by the powerful John Tronolone (Team STOPA). Thankfully he wasn't seriously injured, but left DODGEBALL 66 with a fat lip.
- And in the most intense clash, veterans Kevin Fitzpatrick (Team LEWIS) and Chris Adams (Team STOPA) stole the show. They set the tempo at DODGEBALL 66, one of power throws, quick feet, and agile dodges, each scoring two eliminations on each other. Expect even more from these two in the coming weeks.
Leaders Lauren Stopa and Meredith "Merri" Lewis fought tooth and nail from beginning to end. The end result belonged to Lewis, defeating her adversary 4 - 3.
Three-Peat Records of 66
- Attendance: 16
- Biggest Return: Steve Kass (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LVII)
- New Players: (2) Steve Gr. and Adam S.
- LXIV, LXV, 66 Comparison:
... A traditional night of dodgeball with use of the WHS Front courts and trash cans (3rd week running).
... The lamppost was again the primary light source for 66: the third consecutive week of
Dark Dodgeball
.
... First-time captains, also for the third straight event; Lauren Stopa and Merri Lewis
... Luke, the popular owner of "Luke's Pizza", delivered two free pizzas; chicken pizza and white pie with broccoli. This was actually started at DODGEBALL LX3 [four weeks in a row].
... Though Dan Turner arrived nice and early, he did not participate at DODGEBALL 66, departing before the action kicked off. Therefore, Pond Scum was absent.
- DODGEBALL 66 ended at 10:56pm, making it the longest of the three most recent
Dark Dodgeball
events.
________________________________________
_________________
THE ROAD TO 70
SATURDAY, DECEMBER 30, 2006
This is arguably the most significant ten-event ever. Taking into account the time of year and the longevity of the sport intself, its clear dodgeball has succeeded expectations. Few would have expected to have made it through the first winter, but here
we
are, on the verge of possibly entering our second.
Only three events remain until to the soon-to-be classic event known as DODGEBALL 70, closing out the year. Expect only the best at DODGEBALL 70, whether its the action and players, or to the minor extras like music and pageantry.
The coming weeks couldn't be any more crucial.

Team STOPA vs. Team LEWIS

Kathryn Nogueira and Aimee Savoth started the trend at DODGEBALL LXIV, followed by the wild battle between Sascha Basista and Joey Smalls just last week. At DODGEBALL 66, friends-turned-foes Lauren Stopa and Merri Lewis participated in a rare female-only fray.

But he did and unfortunately halfway through, was met with numbing (literally) faceshot by the powerful John Tronolone (Team STOPA). They set the tempo at DODGEBALL 66, one of power throws, quick feet, and agile dodges, each scoring two eliminations on each other. Expect even more from these two in the coming weeks.

Leaders Lauren Stopa and Meredith "Merri" Lewis fought tooth and nail from beginning to end. The end result belonged to Lewis, defeating her adversary 4 - 3.

Three-Peat Records of 66
- Attendance: 16
- Biggest Return: Steve Kass (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LVII)
- New Players: (2) Steve Gr. and Adam S.

- LXIV, LXV, 66 Comparison:
... A traditional night of dodgeball with use of the WHS Front courts and trash cans (3rd week running).
... The lamppost was again the primary light source for 66: the third consecutive week of Dark Dodgeball.
... First-time captains, also for the third straight event; Lauren Stopa and Merri Lewis
... Luke, the popular owner of "Luke's Pizza", delivered two free pizzas; chicken pizza and white pie with broccoli. This was actually started at DODGEBALL LX3 [four weeks in a row].
... Though Dan Turner arrived nice and early, he did not participate at DODGEBALL 66, departing before the action kicked off. Therefore, Pond Scum was absent.

_________________________________________________________

THE ROAD TO 70

SATURDAY, DECEMBER 30, 2006
This is arguably the most significant ten-event ever. Taking into account the time of year and the longevity of the sport intself, its clear dodgeball has succeeded expectations. Few would have expected to have made it through the first winter, but here we are, on the verge of possibly entering our second.

Only three events remain until to the soon-to-be classic event known as DODGEBALL 70, closing out the year. Expect only the best at DODGEBALL 70, whether its the action and players, or to the minor extras like music and pageantry.

The coming weeks couldn't be any more crucial.
